event_tag.summary: APL Celebrates 50 years of Hip Hop with a variety of events honoring the music, culture, and community.
event_tag.description: APL Celebrates 50 years of Hip Hop with a variety of events honoring the music, culture, and community.

event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

event_tag.name: Pollinator Week
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
event_tag.description: Pollinator Week is an annual celebration in support of pollinator health. Austin Public Library celebrates this week with programs and activities dedicated to increasing community knowledge and adopting pollinator friendly practices.

event_tag.name: Tween Summer
event_tag.description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for tweens ages 9-12 all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!

event_tag.name: Pride
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

event_tag.name: Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander Heritage Month
event_tag.summary: Austin Public Library is proud to celebrate Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month, also known as Asian American Pacific Islander Heritage Month (AAPI). Observed annually in May, AANHPI Heritage Month is a time to reflect upon and celebrate the remarkable role of the AANHPI community in our nation’s history.
event_tag.description: Austin Public Library is proud to celebrate Asian American and Native Hawaiian/Pacific Islander (AANHPI) Heritage Month, also known as Asian American Pacific Islander Heritage Month (AAPI). Observed annually in May, AANHPI Heritage Month is a time to reflect upon and celebrate the remarkable role of the AANHPI community in our nation’s history.

event_tag.name: El día de los niños/El día de los libros
event_tag.subtitle: (Children's Day/Book Day)
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
event_tag.description:
El día de los niños/El día de los libros (Children's Day/Book Day), commonly known as Día, is a celebration every day of children, families, and reading that culminates yearly on April 30. The celebration emphasizes the importance of literacy for children of all linguistic and cultural backgrounds.

Día is a nationally recognized initiative that emphasizes the importance of literacy for all children from all backgrounds. It is a daily commitment to linking children and their families to diverse books, languages and cultures. The common goals of all Día programming are to:

  • Celebrate children and connect them to the world of learning through books, stories and libraries.
  • Nurture cognitive and literacy development in ways that honor and embrace a child’s home language and culture.
  • Introduce families to community resources that provide opportunities for learning through multiple literacies.
  • Recognize and respect culture, heritage and language as powerful tools for strengthening families and communities.

event_tag.name: APL Innovate
event_tag.summary: APL Innovate is Austin Public Library’s digital makerspace for collaboration and creation. We are providing community access to state-of-the-art computer hardware and software to create digital content such as podcasts, videos, 3D renderings, music, and more. Visit our makerspace page for complete information. We hope you’ll join us for a digital makerspace event at the library. After you visit, tell us what you #MadeAtAPL!
event_tag.description: APL Innovate is Austin Public Library’s digital makerspace for collaboration and creation. We are providing community access to state-of-the-art computer hardware and software to create digital content such as podcasts, videos, 3D renderings, music, and more. Visit our makerspace page for complete information. We hope you’ll join us for a digital makerspace event at the library. After you visit, tell us what you #MadeAtAPL!

event_tag.name: Central Library Art Tour
event_tag.summary: Take a staff-guided tour of the Austin Public Library's Central building with a specific focus on the art situated throughout five floors.
event_tag.description: Take a staff-guided tour of the Austin Public Library's Central building with a specific focus on the art situated throughout five floors.

event_tag.name: Books & Breweries
event_tag.subtitle: Every month a different book/brewery
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
event_tag.description: Join us each month to explore a different local Brewery and a book that goes well with beer. From cult novels to contemporary nonfiction; from stouts to sours and everything in between.

event_tag.name: Holistic Wellness Program with the MACC
event_tag.summary: Workshops and classes designed to promote holistic wellness for adults in our community.
event_tag.description: In partnership with the Emma S. Barrientos - Mexican American Cultural Center the Austin Public Library is hosting a series of free workshops and classes designed to promote holistic wellness for adults in our community.

event_tag.name: Teddy Bear
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
event_tag.description: Bring your teddy along for a very special storytime with bear-themed stories, songs, crafts, activities, and play.

event_tag.name: Women's History Month
event_tag.subtitle: Celebrating the accomplishments of women
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
event_tag.description: In the month of March, APL will be celebrating the efforts and accomplishments of women around the world. Join us at one of our many events!

event_tag.name: Dinovember
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.
event_tag.description: Celebrate Dinosaurs all November long, all across APL branches! Dinovember programs will have hands-on science activities, Cretaceous crafts, pop-up museums, special guests, and more! Check out upcoming events below.

event_tag.name: Roots & Wings Festival
event_tag.summary: The Roots & Wings Festival is Austin’s annual celebration of Arbor Day and Monarch Appreciation Day. It is a community—wide celebration of trees, butterflies, bees and nature in our city.
event_tag.description: The Roots & Wings Festival is Austin’s annual celebration of Arbor Day and Monarch Appreciation Day. It is a community—wide celebration of trees, butterflies, bees and nature in our city.

event_tag.name: Miyazaki Fest
event_tag.summary: The Austin Public Library provides a wide variety of events for all ages that are free and open to the public.

event_tag.name: Eat the World
event_tag.description: Join us as we experience the richness of global cultures through regional cuisine! In addition to being able to taste the food, guests will be taught how to prepare the dishes at home. Our cooks will provide step-by-step instructions and point guests to local shops for hard-to-find ingredients.

event_tag.name: Resource Education
event_tag.description: Learn about resources the Library has to offer.

event_tag.name: Celebrations
event_tag.description: Celebrate with the Library!

event_tag.name: Civics
event_tag.description: Join us for workshops or discussions about civics.

event_tag.name: Library Live
event_tag.description: Library Live features free musical performances for the Austin community.

event_tag.name: 2 O'Clock Tunes
event_tag.description: The 2 O'clock Tunes Concert Series, features local music artists and the Electric Lady Bird platform.

event_tag.name: ASL Interpreter Provided
event_tag.description:
An ASL interpreter will be provided for these programs.

The City of Austin is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act. Reasonable modifications and equal access to communications will be provided upon request. For assistance please call 512-974-7449.

event_tag.name: Chinese Mandarin-English Storytime
event_tag.description: This all-ages storytime uses both Chinese Mandarin and English to present books, rhymes, finger-plays, and songs. Materials are not necessarily translated. The storytime flows naturally using both languages, allowing children to feel comfortable in a multilingual environment. No prior experience with Chinese is necessary to participate in.

event_tag.name: College Planning Workshops
event_tag.description: Join Access College America's Dale Price, MBA for a free college planning workshop series. This series of 4 programs is designed for an information packed hour to help you learn how to best assist your child while navigating through the college admission process like a pro.

event_tag.name: Board with Books
event_tag.description:
Do you love playing board games? Then come to Board with Books!

¿Le encantan los juegos de mesa? ¡Venga a Board with Books!

A wide range of modern and traditional board games are available to play. Come and learn something new or bring a personal favorite and teach someone else how to play!

Ofrecemos una gran variedad de juegos de mesas – ambos modernos y tradicionales – para su gusto. ¡Venga a jugar y aprenda algo nuevo o traiga un juego favorito y enseñe cómo jugar a otra persona!

event_tag.name: Early Literacy Playgroup
event_tag.description: Playing is learning! Play is a great way to help develop and reinforce early literacy skills. This come-and-go program is designed to give caregivers and their children time to explore together. Toys, board books, and a weekly craft will be provided.

event_tag.name: Yoga Storytime
event_tag.description:
Practice your mindfulness, hear a story, and learn more about yoga. No mat is required. / Practique como mantenerse enfocado, escuche un cuento, y aprenda más sobre la práctica de Yoga. No necesita traer un tapete para yoga.

Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Please arrive a few minutes early to gain entrance. Note that in some locations, free tickets (available in the branch on the day of the program) will be required for admittance. Contact individual branches to arrange group visits of 5 or more children to storytimes.

event_tag.name: Romance Book Club
event_tag.description: Join us to discuss romance novels, classic romances, Young Adult romance and more!

event_tag.name: Adult Story Hour
event_tag.description: Tell a five minute story – truth, fiction, funny, serious, read or memorized, any story about life, fantasy or yourself. New themes each time!

event_tag.name: Camp Bluebonnet
event_tag.description: We’re Celebrating the Texas Bluebonnet Award by reading books from this year’s list! Remember you’ve got to read 5 to decide and after attending these programs you’ll be well on your way to be qualified to vote next school year! Join us to enjoy a variety of books and related activities.

event_tag.name: Trivia Night
event_tag.description:
Join friends and fans for trivia fun at the Library!

With 8 rounds of 8 questions, bring a team of up to 6 members for question/answer, fill-in-the-blank, audio & video rounds.

Snacks provided.

Recommended for adults.

event_tag.name: APL Volumes
event_tag.description:
Welcome to the home for the new, revamped APL Volumes podcast! This season, we dig up the history of the horror genre with our host, librarian Maddy Newquist.  APL Volumes is recorded and edited in our Innovation Lab, located in the 5th floor Digital Makerspace of our Central location(710 W. Cesar Chavez). 

Click below to listen on any of these platforms:

event_tag.name: Read Watch Talk
event_tag.description: Literature purists will stand by the book. Film buffs will make a case for the movie. Either way, there is something to discuss. Take part in our movie-book club by reading on your own and/or watching with us, and then discussing the merits of each following the film.

event_tag.name: Yoga Meditation Classes
event_tag.description: Learn how to manage stress through yoga and guided meditation techniques.

event_tag.name: Board Games
event_tag.description: Join us for playing a variety of board games.

event_tag.name: Japanese-English Storytime
event_tag.description:
This is a dual language storytime for children aged 5 and under and their caregivers, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and other pre-literacy skill building activities in both English and Japanese.

Some material is presented in English while other material is presented in Japanese, allowing for a natural transition between stories and activities and exposing children to both languages in an inviting environment. Storytime lasts about 30 minutes.

event_tag.name: Writing
event_tag.description: The Austin Public Library invites you to a series of workshops that will teach you the basics of writing for various genres and purposes.

event_tag.name: Music & Movement
event_tag.description: Bring your favorite little one to stretch, sing, dance & explore music with rhythm instruments! Program length can vary. Focuses on the Sing and Play recommendations for early literacy which helps develops gross motor skills, listening skills, and social skills, while introducing new vocabulary.

event_tag.name: Summer for Adults
event_tag.subtitle: Summer at Austin Public Library
event_tag.description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for adults all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!

event_tag.name: Teen Summer
event_tag.subtitle: Summer at Austin Public Library
event_tag.description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for teens ages 13-17 all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!

event_tag.name: Kids Summer
event_tag.subtitle: Summer at Austin Public Library
event_tag.description:
This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here. 

We also have free and fun events for kids ages 6-10 all summer long! Due to popular demand, some programs may require a ticket for entry. Please call your local library branch for more details!

event_tag.name: Business Workshops
event_tag.description: Austin Public Library has many resources for starting a business, such as online databases and workshops led by business professionals.

event_tag.name: Art Reception
event_tag.description: Art reception and show.

event_tag.name: Summer at Austin Public Library
event_tag.description: This summer, we encourage you to read, learn, and earn free prizes! Find more information here.

event_tag.name: Cuentos en español
event_tag.description: Una hora de cuentos en español para niños y niñas desde bebitos hasta edad escolar.

event_tag.name: Spanish Storytime
event_tag.description:
Storytime in Spanish or presented bilingually in Spanish and English / Una hora de cuentos bilingües o en español para toda la familia

Program length can vary. Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Please arrive a few minutes early to gain entrance. Note that in some locations, free tickets (available in the branch on the day of the program) will be required for admittance. Contact individual branches to arrange group visits of 5 or more children to storytimes.

Recomendado para niños y niñas menores de 5 años. Recomendamos que llegue a tiempo, ya que las horas de cuentos comienzan precisamente a la hora programada. Para asegurar tener asiento, por favor llegue unos cuantos minutos antes del comienzo. En algunos locales se requiere tener boleto para entrar (lo puede obtener gratuitamente el mimso día del programa en la sucursal). Llame a la sucursal para hacer arreglos para traer grupos de 5 niños o más a la hora de cuentos.

event_tag.name: Winter Cheer Celebrations
event_tag.subtitle: Holidays, Festivities and More!
event_tag.summary: Join Austin Public Library Winter Cheer Celebrations all season long. Our locations will be hosting fun events and programs all winter celebrating holidays, the changing season, the new year, and MORE! Come spread some cheer with us.
event_tag.description: Come celebrate the holidays with the Austin Public Library!

event_tag.name: Super Smash Bros Tournament
event_tag.description: Are you ready to smash? Compete in the annual Super Smash Bros. for Wii U Summer tournament. All dates are seed tournaments for the Championship finals at the Central Library on August 14. Sign-up begins 30 minutes prior to start time. The first 32 people to sign up are guaranteed a spot to play.  Controllers will be provided but you may also bring your own. Program length is approximately 2 hours.

event_tag.name: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Tournament
event_tag.description:
Compete in the Austin Public Library’s Annual Winter Gaming Tournament.

Doors open for sign-ups 30 minutes before each tournament and the first 32 people to sign up will be assured a spot. Controllers will be provided but you may also bring your own. All dates are seed tournaments for the Grand Championship at the Central Library on January 5, 2020 at 2 PM.  Program length is approximately two hours. 

Something for the whole family! Tournament now played with Mario Kart 8 Deluxe on the SWITCH.

event_tag.name: French-English Storytime
event_tag.description:
Bonjour and welcome to this très special storytime! This is a dual language storytime for children aged 5 and under and their caregivers, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and other pre-literacy skill building activities in both English and Français. Join us, s'il vous plaît!

Some material is presented in English while other material is presented in French, allowing for a natural transition between stories and activities and exposing children to both languages in an inviting environment. Storytime lasts about 30 minutes.

event_tag.name: Art Smart
event_tag.description: Love Art? Let’s be Art Smart and explore different ethnic arts, art media, and techniques at this weekly family art experience for all ages and generations.

event_tag.name: FixIt Clinic
event_tag.description: Fixit Clinics are all about do-it-together, hands-on disassembly, troubleshooting and learning to repair.

event_tag.name: Pop Up Library
event_tag.description: Come visit the Library away from the Library.

event_tag.name: Español
event_tag.description:
• programas y recursos en varios idiomas
    • inglés
    • español
    • formato bilingüe
  • eventos
  • actividades
  • clases
  • gratuitas
  • para todas las edades
  • en un ambiente amigable y seguro
  • pregunte un bibliotecario 512-974-7400
  • nuestra página en español: library.austintexas.gov/es

event_tag.name: Black History Month
event_tag.description:
Celebrate Black History Month at Austin Public Library.

Check out the special exhibits celebrating Black History Month here.

event_tag.name: Write Club
event_tag.description:
Join our creative writing group! Fuel your creativity with short-timed writing exercises using provided prompts. Inspire and be inspired by others! This program is suitable for adults.

This is not a class on how to write. No instruction is given.

event_tag.name: Open Mic
event_tag.description:
The Austin Public Library Hosts Open Mics at various locations. 

Join our Open Mic Facebook Group for regular updates!

event_tag.name: YA For Adults Book Club
event_tag.description: Do you put the adult in YA? Then YAFA is for you! Please join us for some excellent literary conversation.

event_tag.name: Health & Wellness
event_tag.description: The Library offers free programs and workshops to help you improve your health and well-being throughout the year.

event_tag.name: Día de los Muertos
event_tag.description:
A day of fun and laughter, and remembering our loved ones passed. Learn about this traditional holiday with this fun, engaging, cultural program through stories, music, shadow show puppetry, and arts and crafts.

Un día de risas y diversión y de recordar a nuestros queridos muertitos. Aprende sobre este día tradicional con este divertido y encantador programa cultural, por medio de cuentos, música, teatro de sombras y manualidades.

event_tag.name: Conversation Café
event_tag.description: Hungry for conversation? Drop in for open, public dialogue on a variety of topics and add to the diversity of perspectives.

event_tag.name: Central Library Concerts
event_tag.description: Central Library Concerts bring musicians and the community together for free live performances in the heart of downtown Austin.

event_tag.name: Barking Book Buddies
event_tag.description:
Certified Austin Dog Alliance volunteer teams with trained therapy dogs will be waiting for kids to read stories to them. This program improves children’s reading and communication skills by employing a powerful method: reading to a dog. Open to children of all reading levels.

Voluntarios del “Austin Dog Alliance” estarán esperando a todos aquellos niños y niñas que quieran venir a leerles a perros entrenados. Se ha comprobado que este poderoso método ayuda a que los niños mejoren su capacidad de comunicarse con otras personas y también a que eleven su nivel de lectura.

event_tag.name: Music
event_tag.description: Practice music at your neighborhood Library.

event_tag.name: Mayor's Book Club
event_tag.description: The Mayor's Book Club is an annual citywide reading campaign to encourage a community experience through reading, discussion, and exploration of shared books. The Mayor's Book Club is presented by the Library Foundation in partnership with the City of Austin Mayor's Office and the Austin Public Library.

event_tag.name: Hispanic Latino Heritage Month
event_tag.description:
Austin Public Library celebrates Hispanic Heritage Month with rich cultural experiences that enlighten and empower our community.

La Biblioteca Pública de Austin celebra el Mes de la Hispanidad con ricas experiencias culturales que iluminan y fortalecen a nuestra comunidad.

event_tag.name: Toddler Storytime
event_tag.description: A storytime program designed for toddlers aged 18 months to 3 years and their parents, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, and games. Program length can vary.

event_tag.name: Spanish
event_tag.description: The Austin Public Library hosts events, and provides books, movies and music, for all ages in Spanish. All Library events are free and open to the public.

event_tag.name: Preschool Storytime
event_tag.description: Storytime for preschoolers aged 3-5 and their parents featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and crafts. Program length can vary.

event_tag.name: Pajama Storytime
event_tag.description: Feel free to wear pajamas to this family storytime in the evening featuring stories, songs, rhymes, games, crafts, and other activities. Program length can vary.

event_tag.name: Spanish-English Storytime
event_tag.description:
All ages storytime which uses both English and Spanish to present books, rhymes and songs. It differs from a traditional bilingual storytime in that some material is presented in English while other material is presented in Spanish, allowing for a natural transition between stories and activities and exposing children to both languages in an inviting environment. Program length can vary.

Esta hora del cuento es para niños y niñas desde bebitos hasta de edad escolar y para sus padres. Se presentarán libros, rimas, y canciones en inglés y en español. Difiere de un programa tradicionalmente bilingüe en que el material no va a ser traducido de un idioma al otro, sino que presentaremos algunas cosas en inglés y otras en español empapando a los niños en los dos idiomas. De esta manera ellos se sentirán cómodos usando los dos idiomas. Recomendado para niños y niñas menores de 5 años.

event_tag.name: Cuddle Up and Read
event_tag.description:
Please join us for a special lap-sit storytime designed for our youngest library users, ages 0-12 months. Together, we will sing, chant, read and play, helping parents incorporate early childhood literacy practices into their daily life.

Program length can vary.

event_tag.name: Books and Babies
event_tag.description: A lapsit storytime program especially for non-walking babies 0-18 months and their caregivers.  Very short stories are interspersed with songs, rhymes, and fingerplays for babies and parents.  A brief playtime follows. Program length can vary.

event_tag.name: All Ages Storytime
event_tag.description: Storytime for children aged 5 and under and their parents, featuring stories, songs, fingerplays, rhymes, and crafts or other extension activities. Program length can vary.

event_tag.name: Storytimes
event_tag.description:
Storytime programs introduce young children to books, rhymes, music and other fun activities. Austin Public Library offers programs matched to the typical attention spans and developmental levels of different ages of children.

Los programas de Cuentos introducen a los niños a libros, rimas, música y otras actividades divertidas. La Biblioteca Pública de Austin ofrece programas que coinciden con los niveles de desarrollo y la capacidad de atención típica de niños de diferentes edades.

La mayoría de los programas se presentarán en inglés, pero pueden ser disfrutados por personas que hablan otras lenguas.

event_tag.name: Bizaid Business Orientation
event_tag.description: BizAid Orientation provides a general overview on how to open a small business or re-imagine an existing one. Learn how to find assistance at the idea, start-up and existing stages of your business. We will cover key questions entrepreneurs should ask as well as how to find answers and business solutions. BizAid Orientation is free and open to the public, but space is limited so you must register.

event_tag.name: Programs & Workshops
event_tag.description: Library programs and workshops reflect the creative endeavors and diverse interests of the Austin community.

event_tag.name: Minecraft
event_tag.description: Join us for Minecraft free play! Laptops are available. You can also bring your own or other mobile device that has Minecraft downloaded!

event_tag.name: Book Sales
event_tag.description: Join us for a special book sale! Proceeds from book sales directly benefit the Austin Public Library. Want to support the Library with more book sales? Visit Recycled Reads during their operating hours.

event_tag.name: Movies
event_tag.description: Join us for a movie screening. Watch and discover new films at the Austin Public Library.

event_tag.name: Literature Live!
event_tag.subtitle: Jack and the Beanstalk
event_tag.description: When hungry, young Jack trades the family cow for a peddler’s beans, a giant beanstalk leads him to adventure in the castle of a giant and his mother. What happens next will surprise you! Join us for this not-so-traditional puppet show. Recommended for ages 4 and up.

event_tag.name: Talk Time
event_tag.description:
Improve your English conversation. ¡Mejore su conversación en inglés!

Talk Time is a program for English conversation practice with other English language learners and English speaking volunteers. No registration is necessary. The program is open to any adult who speaks some English and wants an informal and safe place to practice with others.

Participe en Talk Time: Hablemos Inglés, un programa gratis de La Biblioteca Pública de Austin, donde usted puede venir a conversar en inglés y así practicar y sentirse más seguro. No es necesario registrarse. Este programa se ofrece a cualquier adulto que hable algo de inglés y que quiera practicarlo con otros en un lugar informal y sin presiones.

event_tag.name: ¡Qué me cuentas!
event_tag.description: Practice and learn Spanish as a second language with ¡Qué me cuentas! Through reading and discussion of Latin-American short stories and newspapers, this group offers a unique way to practice Spanish for more advanced speakers. 40% proficiency in Spanish is preferred.

event_tag.name: Practiquemos Español
event_tag.description: Practiquemos Español is not a Spanish class, but rather a place to fine-tune your Spanish in a relaxed environment under the guidance of a Spanish-speaking facilitator. Participants will need to know a little Spanish to participate.

event_tag.name: Language Practice
event_tag.description: Need to practice English or Spanish? Our Language Practice sessions can help!

event_tag.name: Chess Club
event_tag.description: Learn to play chess! Children under 10 must be accompanied by an adult.

event_tag.name: Controversy & Conversation
event_tag.description:
A series of documentaries about the most controversial issues of the day. Screenings are followed by moderated discussion. Refreshments are served prior to the film and seating begins at 6 PM.

In partnership with the UT Austin Humanities Institute.

event_tag.name: Tech Time
event_tag.description: Learn to download books and use digital Library resources. Bring in your tablet, smartphone or eReader for help navigating the Virtual Library, downloading eBooks, audiobooks, digital magazines and more! Tech Time sessions take place at various Austin Public Library locations throughout town. Drop in anytime during the session. The estimated setup time for each device is about 20 minutes.

event_tag.name: Computer and Job Searching Lab
event_tag.description: Get help with your job search and/or bring your questions about basic computer skills including how to use the internet, email, and Microsoft Word and related topics. No prerequisites.

event_tag.name: Computación Basica
event_tag.description: Aprenda todo lo que necesita saber para comenzar a usar una computadora, desde cómo usar el ratón y el teclado, para una introducción de la internet.

event_tag.name: Basic Computer Skills
event_tag.description: Learn everything you need to know to start using a computer, from how to use a mouse and keyboard to an introduction to the internet. No prerequisites.

event_tag.name: Computers & Technology
event_tag.description: Drop in for free computer training at several Library locations throughout town. Our classes cover topics such as how to use email, look for a job, put finishing touches on your résumé and navigate social media.

event_tag.name: Teen Book Club
event_tag.description: A monthy informal book discussion for avid teen readers.

event_tag.name: NBTween Book Club
event_tag.description: A monthly informal book discussion for avid tween readers and their interested adults. Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Program length is approximately 1 hour. Recommended for ages 8-12 and their adults.

event_tag.name: Mother - Daughter Book Club
event_tag.description: Bring your mom and discuss what you're reading with the group. Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Program length is approximately 1.5 hours.

event_tag.name: Graphic Novel Book Club
event_tag.description: The Graphic Novel Book Club is an adult book club that meets monthly to discuss graphic novels and comics. Whether you’re new to the genre or are a long-time comic-lover you’re sure to find interesting conversation and a chance to read something new!

event_tag.name: Book Circle
event_tag.description: Settle in for a story or two and some hands-on activities. Programs begin on time, for best experience we recommend you do too! Program length is approximately 1 hour.

event_tag.name: Café au Lit
event_tag.description: Can't wait to tell someone about the great book you just read, or don't know what to read next? Come to a different kind of book club where you can read what you like and find out what others are reading at the same time. Join us for coffee, conversation and companionship. It's a great way to get recommendations for trying new genres and authors. It's also a great venue for telling people about that book you just finished that you want EVERYBODY to read!

event_tag.name: Steeped in Books
event_tag.description: Drop in for informal talk and tea to share your thoughts about what you're reading. Don't know what to read? Here's a perfect opportunity to pick up a few recommendations.

event_tag.name: Meet the Author
event_tag.description: Meet the Author events provide an opportunity to hear a writer read their work aloud and discuss it with an audience.

event_tag.name: The Crafty Adult
event_tag.subtitle: formerly known as Night Crafters
event_tag.description: Are you a crafter? Do you wish you were a crafter? We’ll focus on a different craft every month; we’ll learn the basics, we’ll learn the ins and outs, and then we’ll let loose. Come learn with us!

event_tag.name: Crafternoon
event_tag.description: Drop by the library and make a craft while you search for books, movies and music. We've got paper crafts, easy sewing and more fun projects for the whole family. We provide the supplies; you provide the creativity. Program length is approximately 1 hour.

event_tag.name: Lego Lab
event_tag.description: With Legos, you can build anything you can imagine and tell any story you can dream up. Come to the Lego Lab to hear, see, make, and create different stories, all while building with Legos provided by the Library! Program length can vary, please call branch for details.
